column4: <i3luefire> ok. i am having issues getting the transmission-daemon to keep its edited json settings file after a restart. i followed to seperate guides to set it up(http://1000umbrellas.com/2010/10/04/updated-transmission-installationconfiguration-on-ubuntu-server)and(https://trac.transmissionbt.com/wiki/EditConfigFiles) neither worked
<i3luefire> i am running ubuntu-server 11.10

one common gotcha is that transmission allows users to change its settings remotely, so its in-memory config gets dumped to disk in settings.json when it exits. If you're editing settings.json by hand and then stopping->restarting transmission, it's probably overwriting your changes

one way to avoid this problem is to exit transmission-daemon, then edit the file, and then restart transmission daemon. Another way is to force it to reload settings.json after you edit it by sending it a SIGHUP
each of the guides says that and says to reload the daemon first before restarting
yes i did the SIGHUP thing
i3luefire@ubuntu-server:/etc/transmission-daemon$ sudo pkill -HUP transmission-da
http://pastebin.com/SaZvGHYW                                      http://pastebin.com/UafzH6j2
anyone have any ideas

ok. i am having issues getting the transmission-daemon to keep its edited json settings file after a restart. i followed to seperate guides to set it up(http://1000umbrellas.com/2010/10/04/updated-transmission-installationconfiguration-on-ubuntu-server)and(https://trac.transmissionbt.com/wiki/EditConfigFiles) neither worked
<i3luefire> <i3luefire> i am running ubuntu-server 11.10 i did the SIGHUP thing http://pastebin.com/SaZvGHYW                                      http://pastebin.com/UafzH6j2   anyone have any ideas
that was a consolodation of my previous multi-line question so as to comply with !ask | i3luefire
could you be more specific about what error you're encountering?
when you say "neither worked" -- what was the behavior that you saw?

it kept overwriting the files. but now i have tried your solution of stopping editing then starting the deamon and i posted the pastebin of my terminal window with the commands i entered and the error i got and another pastebin of my config file
ah ok, I didn't see the second pastbin, only the first one
the json parser is erroring out because you omitted the comma at the end of line 62, the utp-enabled line
"utp-enabled": true             line
right
needs a comma at the end, like the other lines have
in order to be valid json
thank you
you're welcome
